snippet: Even without sales from the Labor Day weekend, which this year count in September numbers, the two companies had a strong August, but G.M. and other automakers declined.
abstract: Autodata reports August sales of automobiles were essentially flat, down by 0.5 percent from same period year ago; overall sales of family sedan, which amounted to less than 690,000 in August, drags down otherwise improving market for light trucks.
lead_paragraph: Even without sales from the Labor Day weekend, which this year count in September numbers, the two companies had a strong August, but G.M. and other automakers declined.

headline.main: Ford and Fiat Chrysler Post Surprising Sales Gains in August
headline.print_headline: Passenger Car Sales Fall, but Truck Market Stays Robust
